IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE CHARITABLE PURPOSES OF PIAA ARE SET FORTH IN ITS CONSTITUTION WHICH INDICATE PIAA PROMOTES AND SUPPORTS THE EDUCATIONAL VALUES OF INTERSCHOLASTIC ATHLETICS AND THE HIGH IDEALS OF GOOD SPORTSMANSHIP. FURTHER, IT PROMOTES, ESTABLISHES AND ENFORCES UNIFORM STANDARDS IN ATHLETIC COMPETITION AMONG ITS SCHOOLS AND PROMOTES AND SUPPORTS SAFE AND HEALTHY ATHLETIC COMPETITION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE PURPOSES OF PIAA, AS SET FORTH IN ARTICLE II OF ITS CONSTITUTION, ARE: (1) TO ORGANIZE, DEVELOP, AND DIRECT AN INTERSCHOLASTIC ATHLETIC PROGRAM WHICH WILL PROMOTE, PROTECT, AND CONSERVE THE HEALTH AND PHYSICAL WELFARE OF ALL PARTICIPANTS; (2) TO FORMULATE AND MAINTAIN POLICIES THAT WILL SAFEGUARD THE EDUCATIONAL VALUES OF INTERSCHOLASTIC ATHLETICS AND CULTIVATE THE HIGH IDEALS OF GOOD SPORTSMANSHIP; AND (3) TO PROMOTE UNIFORMITY OF STANDARDS IN ALL INTERSCHOLASTIC ATHLETIC COMPETITION. PIAA BELIEVES THAT THE STUDENT-ATHLETE IS BEST SERVED BY A SYSTEM WHICH EMPHASIZES THE AMATEUR, EDUCATIONAL, AND CHARACTER-BUILDING ASPECTS OF HIGH SCHOOL SPORTS AND RECOGNIZES THAT ATHLETICS IS NOT THE DRIVING FORCE. THE STUDENTS ARE IN HIGH SCHOOL PRIMARILY TO OBTAIN AN EDUCATION.
IRS990.Desc: ORGANIZED AND OPERATED STATEWIDE CHAMPIONSHIPS IN THE SPORTS OF BASEBALL, BASKETBALL, CROSS COUNTRY, FIELD HOCKEY, FOOTBALL, GOLF, LACROSSE, SOCCER, SOFTBALL, SWIMMING AND DIVING, TENNIS, TRACK AND FIELD, VOLLEYBALL, COMPETITIVE SPIRIT AND WRESTLING. APPROXIMATELY 350,000 GIRLS AND BOYS PARTICIPATED IN THESE SPORTS LEADING UP TO STATEWIDE CHAMPIONSHIPS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PROVIDED APPROXIMATELY 1,430 MEMBER SCHOOLS SERVICES SUCH AS HOSTING VARIOUS MEETING AND TRAINING SEMINARS, PUBLICATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF THE PIAA HANDBOOK WHICH CONTAINS THE CONSTITUTION, BY-LAWS, POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, RULES AND REGULATIONS, MASTER SCHOOLS LIST AND OTHER INFORMATION; DISTRIBUTION OF PIAA CALENDAR, LEGAL DEFENSE OF CHALLENGES TO ELIGIBILITY RULES, PROVIDING MEMBER SCHOOL FORMS, CATASTROPHIC ACCIDENT INSURANCE, PUBLIC RELATIONS, AND VARIOUS OTHER MEMBER SCHOOL SERVICES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: REGISTERED APPROXIMATELY 14,000 OFFICIALS FOR THE VARIOUS INTERSCHOLASTIC SPORTS IN PENNSYLVANIA, PROVIDED OFFICIATING SUPPLIES, RULES INTERPRETATIONS, RULES BOOKS, TESTING AND OTHER SUPPORT FOR REGISTERED SPORTS OFFICIALS.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: ENHANCE THE IMAGE AND EFFECTIVENESS OF HIGH SCHOOL COACHES TO IMPROVE, PRESERVE, AND PROMOTE INTERSCHOLASTIC ATHLETICS IN PENNSYLVANIA.
OTHER PROGRAMS MAINTAINED BY PIAA INCLUDE SPORTS MEDICINE AND SPORTSMANSHIP, INCLUDING THE AWARDING OF SPORTSMANSHIP SCHOLARSHIPS, AND THE PIAA FOUNDATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION RETAINS LEGISLATIVE COUNSEL TO MONITOR PROPOSED AND/OR EXISTING LEGISLATION THAT MAY HAVE AN IMPACT ON THE MEMBER SCHOOLS OR THE OPERATIONS OF THE ORGANIZATION. ON AN AS NEEDED BASIS, LEGISLATIVE COUNSEL HAS DIRECT CONTACT WITH LEGISLATORS TO ADVISE ON CERTAIN RAMIFICATIONS OF PROPOSED BILLS OR THE IMPACT OTHER EXISTING LEGISLATION IS HAVING ON THE ORGANIZATION. THE PENNSYLVANIA ATHLETC OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE, WHICH IS COMPRISED OF STATE LEGISLATORS, REVIEWS THE ACTIVITIES OF THE ASSOCIATION AND ITS COMPLIANCE WITH CERTAIN STANDARDS SET FORTH IN PA ACT 91 OF 2000, REQUIRING THE ORGANIZATION AND ITS LEGISLATIVE COUNSEL TO HAVE DIRECT CONTACT WITH THE LEGISLATORS ON THE COMMITTEE. THE TOTAL PAID TO THE OUTSIDE LEGISLATIVE COUNSEL DURING THE 2021-2022 YEAR WAS $45,000 OF WHICH AN ESTIMATED $22,500, OR LESS THAN 1% OF TOTAL ORGANIZATION EXPENDITURES, WAS ASSOCIATED WITH DIRECT CONTACT WITH LEGISLATORS.

INCOME TAXES: THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE HAS DETERMINED THAT THE ASSOCIATION IS AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) AND IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX ON ACTIVITIES RELATED TO ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE. ACCORDINGLY, INCOME TAXES, IF ANY, ARE RECORDED ONLY WHEN INCOME IS EARNED ON ACTIVITIES NOT RELATED TO THE ASSOCIATION'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. THE ASSOCIATION FOLLOWS THE PROVISIONS OF FASB'S INCOME TAX TOPIC OF THE ASC WHICH REQUIRES AN ASSESSMENT OF THE ASSOCIATION'S EXPOSURE TO INCOME TAXES AT THE ENTITY LEVEL AS A RESULT OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN IN CURRENT AND PREVIOUSLY-FILED TAX RETURNS. EXAMPLES OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AT THE ENTITY LEVEL INCLUDE CONTINUING QUALIFICATION AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION AND WHETHER THERE IS ANY TAXABLE UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED. ANY TAX BENEFITS ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE IN EXCESS OF A REALIZATION THRESHOLD MUST BE RECORDED AS A LIABILITY FOR UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, ALONG WITH ANY ASSOCIATED INTEREST AND PENALTIES. PRESENTLY, MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THAT IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT ITS TAX POSITIONS WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION, INCLUDING ANY APPEALS AND LITIGATION, AND THEREFORE BELIEVES THAT THE ASSOCIATION HAS NO EXPOSURE TO INCOME TAXES FROM UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSE NETTED AGAINST BOOK REVENUE 28,021.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSE NETTED AGAINST BOOK REVENUE 28,021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MARKET STREET SPORTS GROUP, LLC, RETAINS A 30% COMMISSION ON CASH PAYMENTS AND 10% ON IN KIND DONATIONS FROM CORPORATE SPONSORS OBTAINED FOR INTER-DISTRICT TOURNAMENTS AND PAYS THE NET AMOUNT TO THE ORGANIZATION. ROYAL PUBLISHING, INC., RETAINS 80% OF PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF ADVERTISING IN CHAMPIONSHIP PROGRAMS AND PAYS 20% OF THE GROSS PROCEEDS TO THE ORGANIZATION. FROM ITS SHARE OF THE PROCEEDS, ROYAL PUBLISHING, INC. DIRECTLY PAYS ALL PRINTING AND OTHER PRODUCTION CHARGES ASSOCIATED WITH THE ADVERTISING PAGES IT SELLS. ROYAL PUBLISHING, INC., RETAINS 92% OF PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF ADVERTISING IN DISTRICT 4 PROGRAMS AND PAYS GREATER OF $500 OR 8% OF THE GROSS PROCEEDS TO THE ORGANIZATION. FROM ITS SHARE OF THE PROCEEDS, ROYAL PUBLISHING, INC. DIRECTLY PAYS ALL PRINTING AND OTHER PRODUCTION CHARGES ASSOCIATED WITH THE ADVERTISING PAGES IT SELLS.
ORGANIZATION ONLY MAKES GRANTS TO RELATED 501(C)(3) ORGS AND MONITORS GRANT EXPENDITURES OF RELATED ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH BOARD REPRESENTATION AND REPORTING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOLS, INTERMEDIATE SCHOOLS, JUNIOR HIGH SCHOOLS, AND MIDDLE SCHOOLS, WHICH ARE ACCREDITED BY THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, AND ALL CHARTER SCHOOLS AND PRIVATE SCHOOLS WITHIN PENNSYLVANIA, MEETING MEMBERSHIP REQUIREMENTS, ARE ELIGIBLE FOR MEMBERSHIP IN PIAA. PIAA MEMBER SCHOOLS MUST SPONSOR AT LEAST ONE TEAM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS COMPRISED OF: 1. ONE OR MORE REPRESENTATIVES FROM EACH OF THE 12 PIAA DISTRICTS. EACH DISTRICT IS ENTITLED TO ONE REPRESENTATIVE FOR THE FIRST 50 MEMBER SENIOR HIGH SCHOOLS OR FRACTION THEREOF AND ADDITIONAL MEMBERS FOR EACH 50 ADDITIONAL MEMBER SENIOR HIGH SCHOOLS OR MAJOR FRACTION THEREOF. THE CURRENT BOARD HAD 18 MEMBERS REPRESENTING THE 12 DISTRICTS. 2. ONE MEMBER AT LARGE ELECTED BY AND FROM THE JUNIOR HIGH/MIDDLE SCHOOLS' REPRESENTATIVES OF THE DISTRICT COMMITTEES. 3. TWO REPRESENTATIVES OF THE PENNSYLVANIA SCHOOL BOARDS ASSOCIATION (PSBA). 4. A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE PENNSYLVANIA ASSOCIATION OF SCHOOL ADMINISTRATIORS (PASA). 5. A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE PENNSYLVANIA ASSOCIATION OF SECONDARY SCHOOL PRINCIPALS (PASSP). 7. A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE PENNSYLVANIA STATE ATHLETIC DIRECTORS' ASSOCIATION (PSADA). 8. A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE PENNSYLVANIA COACHES' ASSOCIATION (PCA). 9. A FEMALE OFFICIAL ELECTED BY THE FEMALE OFFICIALS MEMBERS OF THE DISTRICT COMMITTEES AND A MALE OFFICIAL ELECTED BY THE MALE OFFICIALS MEMBERS OF THE DISTRICT COMMITTEES. 10. CHAIRPERSON OF THE GIRLS' ATHLETICS STEERING COMMITTEE. 11. CHAIRPERSON OF THE PRIVATE SCHOOLS' STEERING COMMITTEE. 12. A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION (PDE), APPOINTED BY THE SECRETARY OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. 13. ONE FEMALE AND ONE MALE REPRESENTATIVE, SELECTED BY AND FROM THE PARENTS' ADVISORY COMMITTEE. SEE PIAA CONSTITUTION FOR ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS FOR ABOVE CATAGORIES OF BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AMENDMENTS TO THE PIAA CONSTITUTION MUST BE APPROVED EITHER BY TWO-THIRDS OF THE SCHOOLS VOTING OR BY A MAJORITY OF THE TOTAL MEMBERSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND BUSINESS OPERATIONS SUPERVISOR PERFORM A DETAILED REVIEW OF THE FORM 990. A COPY OF THE RETURN IS THEN PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN AN ANNUAL STATEMENT REGARDING ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND ARE PROHIBITED FROM VOTING ON MATTERS IN WHICH THEY HAVE A CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HUMAN RESOURCES COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD MAKES COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BUDGET COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD, WHO APPROVES, ADJUSTS OR ACCEPTS THE RECOMMENDATIONS. CONTRACT EXTENSIONS ARE ACTED UPON ANNUALLY AND IN CONSIDERING THE COMPENSATION AMOUNTS, THE COMMITTEES INVOLVED CONSIDER AMOUNTS PAID FOR COMPARABLE STATE HIGH SCHOOL ASSOCIATIONS' POSITIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PIAA'S CONSTITUTION, BYLAWS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND OTHER POLICIES ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE IN THE RESOURCE HANDBOOK SECTION.
THERE HAVE BEEN NO CHANGES FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
